Great! You have:


Frontend: TypeScript React


Backend: Express (Node.js)


Goal: Host for free

The best free choices right now are:
ğŸ¥‡ Railway (free tier) or ğŸ¥ˆ Render (free tier)

Both can host your full-stack Node + static React build. Iâ€™ll show the easiest full-stack 
method (one deployment).

ğŸ‰ Best Option: Host Both Together on Railway/Render
ğŸ“Œ Step 1 â€” Build your React Client
Open terminal:
cd client
npm install
npm run build

This creates a build/ folder.

ğŸ“Œ Step 2 â€” Make Express Serve the React Build
In your server folder, modify your Express app:
import express from "express";
import path from "path";
import { fileURLToPath } from "url";
const __filename = fileURLToPath(import.meta.url);

"server": "nodemon server/index.js",
    "client": "npm start --prefix client",
    "build": "npm install --prefix client && npm run build --prefix client"
  }
}

(Make sure your entry file is server/index.js or adjust path.)

ğŸ“Œ Step 4 â€” Push to GitHub
Make sure your repo has this structure:
/client
/server
package.json  (root)

Commit and push to GitHub.

ğŸš€ Step 5 â€” Deploy on Railway (FREE)

Go to https://railway.app/


Login with GitHub


Click New Project â†’ Deploy from GitHub Repo

Select your repo


Important:


Set Root project path to your root, not /client or /server.

Add Environment Variables
â†’ Railway â†’ Variables â†’ Add:
PORT=8080

(any other secrets like Mongo URL)


ğŸŠ Done! Your app URL will look like:
https://yourapp.up.railway.app/
